text: so sure one thing is clear this has
nothing to do with the United States
these employees and not American
citizens and if something did happen
then it didn't happen on the territory
of the United States it's just another
attempt to extend their jurisdiction to
other countries and I have no doubt
that's all that it's a blatant attempt
to prevent the re-election of mr.
Blatter as president of FIFA which is a
clear violation of the way international
organizations should function one of the
main sponsors of footballs World Cup now
says it will reassess its a deal with
FIFA unless it takes immediate steps to
restore the game's reputation the
statement from visa follows the dramatic
arrests on Wednesday of several senior
FIFA officials on corruption charges
visa has said it feels profound
disappointment and concern over the
allegations other sponsors have also
spoken out adidas says it expected the
highest standards of ethics and
compliance coca-cola said a lengthy
controversy has tarnished the mission
and ideals of the FIFA World Cup and
McDonald's describe the developments as
extremely concerning FIFA's long-term
president Sepp Blatter has canceled a
public appearance but is still expected
to give a speech when the FIFA
conference opens in Zurich on Thursday
afternoon meanwhile European football's
governing body UEFA is calling for a
change in leadership at FIFA and there
is pressure to postpone FIFA's
leadership vote on Friday
